Package org.opengis.filter

Interface LogicalOperator<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of inputs to filter.
All Superinterfaces:
Filter<T>, Predicate<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
BinaryLogicOperator<T>, UnaryLogicOperator<T>
@Classifier(ABSTRACT) @UML(identifier="LogicalOperator", specification=ISO_19143) public interface LogicalOperator<T> extends Filter<T>
Combination of one or more conditional expressions. The logical operator AND evaluates to true if all the combined expressions evaluate to true. The operator OR evaluates to true is any of the combined expressions evaluate to true. The NOT operator reverses the logical value of an expression.
Since:
3.1

  • Method Details

    • getOperatorType

      CodeList<?> getOperatorType()
      Returns the nature of the operator. The code list can be UnaryLogicType or BinaryLogicType, depending on the sub-interface.
      Returns:
      the nature of the operator.

    • getExpressions

      default List<Expression<? super T,​?>> getExpressions()
      Returns an empty list since logical operator have no expressions. Instead, the operands are other filters.
      Specified by:
      getExpressions in interface Filter<T>
      Returns:
      an empty list.

    • getOperands

      List<Filter<? super T>> getOperands()
      Returns a list containing all of the child filters of this object. This list will contain at least one element, and each element will be an instance of Filter.
      Returns:
      all child filters used as operands.
